audioJson.name: Gramophone disc
audioJson.aka: 78s, Durinoid, Edison Diamond Disc, lacquer discs, Phonographic disc, record, shellac records, victrola
audioJson.fact1: Earlier discs in this format were made from a shellac (a resin secreted by Iac insects) combined with other materials
audioJson.fact2: Early recordings differed in speeds, ranging from 60-130 revolutions per minute (rpm), but 78 rpm became the industry-wide standard by the mid-1920s until the introduction of the microgroove disc in the 1940s
audioJson.fact3: This format was eventually replaced by the microgroove disc, introduced by Columbia in 1948
